text: Hi, I anyone have experience setting up a Content Security Policy (CSP) for the CMS? Anyone have an example or guide we can use? Thanks!
Hi <@U03AKL6Q1B2>, can you please explain why it takes longer to clear out the server cache?Thx!
<@UBT0AHWLD> I don't know the answer, only from years of experience. The server caches images and content just like browsers to improve loading speed.

Hi there, anyone managed to have system pages (404 for instance) in multi languages?
We use glossary for everything but I see that these pages are not "affected" by it.
Thanks
Hey <@U02LGCXPSCW>, I am seeing a similar issue this week. Did you ever get any additional info here?
<@U01AHCQ7EJC> No, no additional info yet, I don’t know whom I can ping directly here...? I’m quite new in this community :slightly_smiling_face:
Does HubSpots jQuery settings option need to be enabled? Or can a site run without that option checked?

If youre building from scratch, you should be able to toggle that off. However, if youve a legacy site or are inheriting a site I would be cautious with turning it off as some js might be relying on it. Same is the case for migrating the script from header to footer or even updating to a newer version. I believe that toggle loads a pretty outdated version of JQuery.
Is `/_hcms/perf` important for anything?

Does anyone have a shareable solution for having lazy loaded images start loading earlier? There have been some reports in our team that the UX isn’t great with just having the images pop in as you scroll.
Maybe scroll detection and swapping the lazy attribute with eager when you get to y offset? Not sure if that would work.

Any help with the mobile hamburger menu dropdown not opening on some mobile devices? Also, the drop down menu (about us) link takes us to a different page than does on desktop. <http://ascensionRS.com|ascensionRS.com>
is it on purpose that you are not showing the submenu on mobile?
on mobile you just show about, which is of course different to your about us page
that is why it is taking you to a different page
no, it works for some mobile devices but not others
ok
about has a dropdown menu with 5 options that also includes"about us" in the dropdown
<@U0427CEV6BD> it seems there is a bug on the drop-down menu. A drop-down icon is partially transparent or set hidden and just works on the first click event but after that it is not working.
the dropdown doesn't open on some devices and the link on mobile of about us takes us to a different page than does on desktop
any ideas on the fix?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/cms/guides/jquery/upgrade>

hey <@U01D95STUS3> thanks for the tips, now it is complaining about being unable to load the config from environment variables.
was it the `--use-env` suppose to handle that to use the environment variables instead of `HubSpot.config.yml` ?
:wave: Hi everyone!

I have a very crucial question. I am trying to understand how dynamic is the <//js.hs-scripts.com/xxxxx.js> . If I get it right, when the user asks to be hosted in a EU server then the url becomes js-eu1. In any other case, <http://js.hs-scripts.com|js.hs-scripts.com>. Am I right?
Is it possible to have js-eu2 or anything else?
